div.pre: 1424 Mersin (anc. Zephyrium), Cilicia, c. 1963 Burial: c. 280 B.C. (M) Contents: 150+ AR Lot A Alexander III: 58 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 18, Pella ? 2 as BMC 198 var. and 202, Sicyon 1, unc. Peloponnesus 2, Miletus 2, Sardes 1, Salamis 1, Aradus 4, Byblus 7, Sidon 2, Tyre 2, Ace 2, Babylon 7, unc. mints 7) Philip III: 6 tetradr. (Marathus 1, Babylon 3, Susa 2) Demetrius Poliorcetes: 21 tetradr. (Amphi- polis 3, Pella 4, unc. Macedonia 1, Chalcis 2, Ephesus 2, Tarsus 2, Salamis 7 Lysimachus: 4 lifetime tetradr. (Amphi- polis 2, Lampsacus 2) Seleucus I: 11 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim 4, Susa 1, Seleuceia Pieria 3, An- tiocheia 1, Tarsus 1, unc. 1 as WSM 1346) Lot B Alexander III and Philip III: 26 tetradr. (various mints) Seleucus I: 4 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim 1, Seleuceia Pieria 1, Sardes 2) Lot C Alexander III: 2 tetradr. (Amphipolis 1, unc. 1) Lysimachus: 31 tetradr. (Lampsacus c. 30, Pergamum 1) Seleucus I: 1 tetradr. (Sardes) Disposition: dispersed; photos of lot A at ANS The three lots, although recorded sepa- rately, seem to belong to the same hd. For lots A and B the provenance "Mersin" was given, for lot C "Asia Minor." Lots B and C appeared in 1963, lot A in 1966. There may well be some duplication among the records
